by.translation[0].definitions[0].definit: used especially with a passive verb to say who or what does something or makes something happen
by.translation[0].definitions[0].example: I was attacked by a dog.
a church designed by the famous architect, Sir Christopher Wren
We are all alarmed by the rise in violent crime.
interference by the state in the affairs of the Church
his appointment by the BBC as a producer
by.translation[0].definitions[1].definit: used to say what means or method someone uses to do something
by.translation[0].definitions[1].example: You can reserve the tickets by phone.
Some customers prefer to pay by cheque.
He was taken from his home by force.
They travelled to Chicago by train.
All supplies are transported by air.
She earns her living by selling insurance.
by.translation[0].definitions[2].definit: used to say which road, entrance, door etc someone uses to get to a place
by.translation[0].definitions[2].example: They came in by the back door.
It’s quicker to go by the country route.
by.translation[0].definitions[3].definit: used to say which part of an object or of a person’s body someone takes hold of
by.translation[0].definitions[3].example: He took Elaine by the arm and led her across the road.
She grabbed the hammer by the handle.
by.translation[0].definitions[4].definit: used to give the name of someone who wrote a book, produced a film, wrote a piece of music etc
by.translation[0].definitions[4].example: a short story by Charles Dickens
by.translation[0].definitions[5].example: Jane went and sat by Patrick.
by.translation[0].definitions[6].definit: past someone or something without stopping
by.translation[0].definitions[6].example: He walked right by me without even saying hello.
I pass by the farm every day on my way to work.
by.translation[0].definitions[7].definit: before or not later than a particular time
by.translation[0].definitions[7].example: The documents need to be ready by next Friday.
I reckon the film should be over by 9.30.
By the end of the day we had sold over 2,000 tickets.
By the time we got home we were tired and hungry.
by.translation[0].definitions[8].definit: according to a particular rule, method, or way of doing things
by.translation[0].definitions[8].example: You’ve got to play by the rules.
Profits were £6 million, but by our standards this is low.
by.translation[0].definitions[9].definit: used to say how great a change or difference is
by.translation[0].definitions[9].example: The price of oil fell by a further $2 a barrel.
Godard’s first film was better by far (=by a large amount or degree).
by.translation[0].definitions[10].defini: used to give the measurements of a room, container etc
by.translation[0].definitions[11].defini: used to show what unit of measurement or quantity is involved in selling, paying for, producing etc something
by.translation[0].definitions[11].exampl: Eggs are sold by the dozen.
She wanted to tear his hair out by the handful.
by.translation[0].definitions[12].defini: used to say that something happens gradually
by.translation[0].definitions[12].exampl: Day by day, he grew weaker.
Little by little, I was beginning to discover the truth about Garfield.
One by one, the men stepped forward.
by.translation[0].definitions[13].defini: used to say that something or someone is quickly becoming worse, better etc
by.translation[0].definitions[13].exampl: The financial crisis was growing more serious by the hour.
by.translation[0].definitions[14].defini: used to say that something happens in a particular kind of light
by.translation[0].definitions[14].exampl: We walked through the palace gardens by moonlight.
by.translation[0].definitions[15].defini: used when you are giving information about someone’s character, job, origin etc
by.translation[0].definitions[15].exampl: George I and George II were Germans by birth.
Cautious by nature, Simpkin was reluctant to interfere.
Robert Key was a teacher by profession.
by.translation[0].definitions[16].defini: in order to visit a person or place for a short time
by.translation[0].definitions[16].exampl: On the way, I stopped by the post office.
by.translation[0].definitions[17].defini: used between two numbers when talking about multiplying or dividing
by.translation[0].definitions[18].defini: used when expressing strong feelings or making serious promises
by.translation[0].definitions[18].exampl: By God, I’ll kill that boy when I see him!
by.translation[0].definitions[19].defini: if a woman has children by a particular man, that man is the children’s father
by.translation[0].definitions[19].exampl: She’s got two children by her previous husband.
by.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: USAGE: By, with
by.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0].e: By is used, especially after passive verbs, to say who or what does something
The article was written by a university professor
She was hit by a truck
by.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1].e: With is used after verbs that describe a state rather than an action
The books were covered with dust
Her house is always filled with music
by.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2].e: By is used to say what means or method someone uses to do something
by.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3].e: With is used to say what tool is used to do something
Clean the surface thoroughly with a wire brush
by.translation[1].definitions[0].example: As I was standing on the platform, the Liverpool train went whizzing by.
James walked by without even looking in my direction.
by.translation[1].definitions[1].definit: used to say that time passes
by.translation[1].definitions[1].example: As the summer days slipped by, it was easy to forget about the war.
Ten years had gone by since I had last seen Marilyn.
by.translation[1].definitions[2].definit: beside or near someone or something
by.translation[1].definitions[2].example: A crowd of people were standing by, waiting for an announcement.
by.translation[1].definitions[3].definit: in order to visit a person or place for a short time
by.translation[1].definitions[3].example: Why don’t you stop by for a drink after work?
by.translation[2].definitions[0].example: a by-product  (=something made in addition to the main product)
a by-election  (=one held between regular elections)
